meanings.definition: An amount of alcohol that is enough to make someone drunk.
meanings.sent1: After having a skinful at the party, he could barely walk straight.
meanings.sent2: She had a skinful of beer and started dancing on the table.
meanings.sent3: He thought he could handle a skinful of whiskey, but ended up regretting it the next morning.
meanings.sent4: The group of friends shared a skinful of rum around the campfire.
meanings.sent5: The bartender refused to serve him another skinful, knowing he had already had enough.

meanings.definition: Having or containing a large amount of alcohol.
meanings.sent1: The punch bowl was filled with a skinful mixture that packed a punch.
meanings.sent2: The strong smell indicated that the drink was indeed skinful.
meanings.sent3: The skinful cocktail was a hit at the party, leaving everyone in high spirits.
meanings.sent4: She took a sip of the skinful beverage and felt warmth spreading through her body.
meanings.sent5: The bar served only the most skinful drinks for the daring customers.
